Posts.Content: After almost 13 years being cancer free, I have just been diagnosed with breast cancer in the same breast. With the original breast I had a lumpectomy, chemo, radiation, 5 years of tamoxifen and another 2 years of Femara. I'm facing a mastectomy and anguishing over the decision of having the right breast removed just to eliminate the possibility of going through this again. I'm a month and a half shy of being 68 years old and have no other medical difficulties. I'm reaching out to anyone that has faced similar circumstances.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recurrence after 10-years

Posts.Content: On Feb 22, 2013 10:12 PM larue wrote: Tina, Were you node negative? and /or estrogen positive? It seems from all I can read or tell that for estrogen positive cancer there is no limit to how long after treatment a recurrence can happen. I'm only 2 1/2 years out from my dx and I'm still cancer free, but it sounds like I will be on femara for the next 10 years and then something else.Hi, my original cancer was estrogen positive. The sentinel node was positive for cancer; they removed 7 more and all were negative. I really thought I was out of the woods with 13 years behind me. That's why I'm considering the double mastectomy.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recurrence after 10-years

Posts.Content: On Feb 22, 2013 5:49 PM pen03072002 wrote: I don't know what I am going to do if that is the same thing I face.  Like you I had a lumpectomy; 17 lymph nodes revove (4 were possitive); chemotherapy (very aggressive); radiation and 2 1/2 years of Arimidex.  I now too have a lump in the same breat and I feel like "here I go again".  I am seriously thinking if it is the case the Cancer is back of doing both breasts my problem will be the expense as I know my insurance will not pay for the non-cancerous breast removal and I am on a fixed income.  Good luck and know that others will be thinking and praying for you.Have you scheduled an ultrasound and/or biopsy? Your insurance should pay for that. Thank you for your prayers and I, too, will include you in mine.
